fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pipelines unable to parse service if one of the service variables is empty.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a parallel step
# Add service under the steps
# Creat service variable and let the variable empty

h3. Expected Results
Pipelines should return a more generic error that the variable is empty

h3. Actual Results
Pipeline return a general error without much information
fields.summary: Pipelines unable to parse service if one of the service variables is empty.

fields.description:
I recently attempted to disable two-step verification, but continue to be redirected to the “6-digit verification code” screen.

Verification codes in my authenticator app no longer work, but I can still login using the 24-character emergency recovery key, save the new key and continue.

At this point, two-step verification is disabled. I tried re-enabling it, scanning the QR code, entering the current verification code to confirm, logging out, logging in and the verification codes don’t work. I then enter the emergency key, save the new one and continue.

At this point, two-step verification is enabled. I disable it, log out, log in, and again I’m redirected to the verification code screen. Rinse, repeat — same result from incognito windows. You can see the two-step enable/disable activities in my account’s audit log — the last being to disable it.

Right now I can continue to use the recovery key, save the new one and continue, but I’m wondering what I’m doing wrong, if there’s something not getting updated on my account or if there’s some timeframe I need to wait before the changes take effect.

Apologies if this is a dupe — I checked and didn’t find another issue describing this scenario.

Much appreciated.
fields.summary: Can't completely disable two-step verification; Can't use new verification codes after disabling / re-enabling

fields.description:
We’ve got rules that prevent merging pull requests if there are any outstanding tasks. Unfortunately Bitbucket is sometimes confused as to the existence of outstanding tasks, and we have had numerous occasions in the past where all tasks are actually marked as complete, but it reports that there are still open tasks - previously we’ve been able to toggle tasks and it would update the count to reflect reality, but we’ve just run into a pull request where that work-around is not successful. In order to merge this I’ll need to temporarily disable the merge rule, which is both annoying, and a bit of a problem from a code sanitation perspective.

!3722774512-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Phantom tasks in pull requests

fields.summary: Unable to create branches

fields.description:
Would be nice to have the ability to mark files as viewed: [https://github.blog/2019-07-01-mark-files-as-viewed/|https://github.blog/2019-07-01-mark-files-as-viewed].

“After you finish reviewing a file, you can mark the file as viewed, and the file will collapse. If the file changes after you view the file, it will be unmarked as viewed.”
fields.summary: Mark Files as Viewed

fields.description: The Branching Models only have a Production and Development. In my work place we have a Staging in between these two. What would be nice is to be able to either have an extra one or be able to dynamically add many.
fields.summary: Branching Models to have more "levels"

fields.description:
Hey folks,

We’re using Mercurial for game development, and we need to be able to check in assets with code - we really, really need them in sync.

We already hand off huge assets like audio + video to Dropbox, where it isn’t so crucial that they stay in sync with code, but we still hit the 2gb limit, about once every 4-6 months.

What we’ve been doing is using the Convert extension, to convert from hg → hg, omitting everything except code, so that we only keep the code history, manually copying everything else over, and pushing the result to a brand new repo, before migrating everyone to it. It’s quite tedious.

What would be far preferable is the ability to set a per directory 'history count', so that we only store 2 previous versions for asset directories. Or to allow us to the history from selected directories in place from the website. Anything but having to migrate to a new repo when we hit the limit.

We love Mercurial - it’s perfect for us for everything except this issue.   I guess the alternative would be that we move to git + gitlfs, but we’re not in a good place to do that with our current project.

cheers,

Ricky
fields.summary: Suggested Functionality to Better Manage Repo Size

fields.description:
If you have an existing pull request and you've merged it locally via squash merge, the PR is not being updated and remains in Open state.

*Steps to reproduce*:

# Create a new branch (branch_a) from master
# Change the code into branch_a branch
# Open a Pull Request: from new branch -> master
# Clone the repo locally
# git checkout master && git pull
# git merge --squash 'origin/branch_a' --no-commit #merge successful
# git commit -m 'merge via command line' && git push origin master # upload to master successful
# Go back to the pull request and see the PR status

h3. Expected Result
The PR status will be updated to "MERGED"

h3. Actual Result
The PR status will is not being updated
fields.summary: Squash merge locally is not updating the PR status

fields.description:

But, the same functionality is not available with API 2.0. Also, we don't have a Delete Method available for the same.
fields.summary: API 2.0 Endpoint for revoking access to team members

fields.description:
Pull request activity links to a comment breaks when you renamed a file with that comment.

*Steps to reproduce*:

# Create a PR, or use an existing PR
# Add a comment on a file
# Refresh the PR page then in the "Activity" on the right pane, there's a log that has the "Commented on <File Name>" entry.
# Clone the repo locally then rename that file with the comment in the PR
# Push the renamed file
# Go back to the PR
# Click the comment link on the "Activity" right pane

!2051163882-PR_Comment_file_renamed.gif|thumbnail!

h3. Enhancement Request
Since the file has been renamed, it would best to just remove the comment's link on the "Activity" right pane.
fields.summary: Pull request link to a comment breaks when a file is renamed

fields.description:
In Pull Requests in Bitbucket, the author of the pull request can approve the PR. This counts towards the minimum number of approvals required to merge a PR.

I think this should not be the case. The author of a pull request should not be able to approve their own pull request.
fields.summary: Authors self-approving Pull Requests

fields.description:
when adding services to my pipeline config I receive the following message: “The step provided was invalid.”

Here is my config:

{code}
image: circleci/ruby:2.6.3-node-browsers

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:          # non-parallel step
        name: Build
        script:
          - ./.ci/build.sh
        caches:
          - vendor-bundle
          - yarn-cache
          - node-modules
          - cache-cypress
        artifacts:
          - node_modules/**
          - vendor/bundle/**
    - parallel:
        - step:
            name: Rspec
            services:
              - postgres
            script:
              - ./.ci/rspec.sh
        - step:
            name: Cypress
            script:
              - ./.ci/cypress.sh
        - step:
            name: Jest
            script:
              - ./.ci/jest.sh
        - step:
            name: Static Analyisis
            script:
              - ./.ci/static_analysis.sh

definitions:
  services:
    postgres:
      image: postgres
      variables:
        POSTGRES_USER: nexl_db_user
        POSTGRES_DB: nexl_test
        POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ""
  caches:
    vendor-bundle: vendor/bundle
    yarn-cache: ~/.cache/yarn
    node-modules: node_modules
    cache-cypress: ~/.cache/Cypress
{code}

When I “services:” at line 20, i get the error.

Can you please assist.
fields.summary: Pipelines errors if variable for service is empty

Current Behaviour:\\
At the moment, when pipelines are disabled and if there were any builds that would be running. They would run to completion and all new builds would be suspended.\\
If the ongoing builds need to be stopped, then you need to manually stop the build.

Expected Behaviour:\\
Request is to suspend and stop all on-going builds once pipelines are disabled. This prevents users from manually stop all builds running.
fields.summary: Stop all builds when pipelines are disabled

fields.description:
Would be nice to have something similar to [https://github.blog/2019-02-14-introducing-draft-pull-requests/|https://github.blog/2019-02-14-introducing-draft-pull-requests].

A useful snippet: “A draft pull request is styled differently to clearly indicate that it’s in a draft state. Merging is blocked in draft pull requests. Change the status to “Ready for review” near the bottom of your pull request to remove the draft state and allow merging according to your project’s settings. Also, if you have a [CODEOWNERS file|https://github.blog/2017-07-06-introducing-code-owners] in your repository, a draft pull request will suppress notifications to those reviewers until it is marked as ready for review.”
fields.summary: Draft State for Pull Requests

git@bitbucket.org: Permission denied (publickey).
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
{code}

{code}
ssh://git@bitbucket.org/dresearchfe/drsbbs.git  failed with exit code 128, output:
ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
{code}

Can you please check, why the server refuses the connection.

As we had these issues already often before, I assume the basic problem should be already known.

Thanks,

Andreas

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, deleting a Bitbucket account will also trigger the deletion of the Atlassian account with the same email.

This is not always desirable, as sometimes the user may have access to JIRA or Confluence Cloud with the same email (Atlassian account) and want to keep this one and delete only the Bitbucket account.

h3. Suggested Solution
For non-managed accounts, allow users to delete their Bitbucket account with the option to retain the Atlassian account, if they want to.

For managed accounts, allow admins to delete a user's Bitbucket account without deleting the user's Atlassian account.

h3. Workaround
Contact Bitbucket Cloud support to have only the Bitbucket Cloud account deleted.
fields.summary: Allow users to delete their Bitbucket account without deleting the Atlassian account

fields.description: I think the Merge button should not be a call-to-action. Instead you could make it so that the Merge button is only a call to action if the currently logged-in user is the author of the PR. For other users, make the Approve button the call-to-action.
fields.summary: Merge button on pull-requests is a call-to-action

fields.description:
Since git branch names are handled differently on depending on what filesystem is used, issues can arise when branch names are used which only difference is the casing.

Of course you shouldn't push branch names where only the casing is different but it can easily happen by accident.

On MacOS when I try to pull a repo where  to branches have the same same, only difference being the casing from Bitbucket I get the following error message:

error: cannot lock ref 'refs/remotes/origin/Branchname': is at <<first sha1 hash>> but expected <<second sha1 hash>>\\
From https://bitbucket.org/org/repo\\
! sha1..sha1  Branchname -> origin/Branchname  (unable to update local ref)

Since Bitbucket will allow both branches to be pushed but doesn't show both branches on the web interface, I think this is a problem with Bitbucket, not just with git.
fields.summary: It's possible to push branch names only different by casing but the web interface doesn't show both

fields.description:
Firefox 67.0.4\\
Ubuntu Linux 18.04.2 LTS

To reproduce: Go to the “commits” page, middle or right click on a link embedded in a commit message - eg. a link to a PR, or a Jira issue

Actual result: The page navigates to the link target

Expected result: Middle click should open the link in a new tab and leave the current page loaded, Right click should open the context menu only, the page should not navigate at all

Note: this only happens in Firefox, Chrome works as expected
fields.summary: middle click and right click not working on links embedded in commit message (in firefox)

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary
When a user tries to create a pull request to its empty parant repository, they see an error below:

{quote}
Something went wrong
While we check things on our end, refresh the page and contact support if the problem persists.
When contacting support, provide them with this code:
...
{quote}

h2. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a repository and leave it empty
* Create a fork from the created repository
* Push a change to the forked repository
* Try to create a pull request to the original repository from the forked repository

h2. Expected Results
Users are able to create a repository towards an empty repository.

h2. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in application log:

{code}
AttributeError: NoneType object has no attribute resolve.
{code}

h2. Workaround
Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.

Until then,

* Commit an arbitarary file to the original repository
* Then create a pull reqeust

h2. Bugfix Policy
At the moment, Atlassian can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
fields.summary: Unable to create a pull request towards an empty repository

fields.description:
I have a repository in the Bitbucket Cloud.

Everytime it recieves a commit, I want it to trigger a plan from Bamboo Server.

I’ve already setup the Bamboo Server “Remote Trigger” configs.

I’ve also successfully tested with older repos which still have the “Services Button“ and it worked as expected.

The problem is that I have a recent repository which has the “Services Button“ replacement (“Webhooks Button“).

After looking online for “How to integrate Bamboo Server with Bitbucket Cloud“ and “Bamboo Server Remote Trigger from Bitbucket Cloud“, I saw some answer that look promising: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bamboo-questions/Remote-Trigger-Bamboo-build-from-BitBucket-webhook/qaq-p/900429|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bamboo-questions/Remote-Trigger-Bamboo-build-from-BitBucket-webhook/qaq-p/900429], [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-configure-jira-webhook-to-trigger-bamboo-build-947861226.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-configure-jira-webhook-to-trigger-bamboo-build-947861226.html] and others, but some of them gave “HTTP status 401” or ““HTTP status 302”.

Is there any way to trigger a bamboo plan with the “Remote Trigger“ method from Bitbucket Cloud?
fields.summary: Services replaced by Webhook

fields.description:
I have some feedback regarding the current commit view. There are two things that make it sometimes inconvenient to understand.

First, it would be nice to have the master branch handles specially, perhaps by always having the same distinctive style, like being black or bolder than other lines, and also maybe always on the left-most side, so that it is easy to see where it is, and when others are branched off. Right now, a branch will just extend from master in the same column with a similar color, making it hard to see at a glance that it is a branch.

Second, it would be nice to have the option to compress the commits, and see only branches. Basically all branches with more than one commit appear as only a single node. Maybe this belongs in the branches view, but it would be nice anywhere.

Thanks
fields.summary: Better Commit View

fields.description:
This feature request arises from the response to this question: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-Pipelines-questions/Can-a-dependency-cache-cause-incorrect-builds/qaq-p/1116127|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-Pipelines-questions/Can-a-dependency-cache-cause-incorrect-builds/qaq-p/1116127]

The proposed feature would allow a given dependency cache to be linked to a file in the repository such that if there are any changes to that file in the current commti, the associated cache is cleared before any pipeline steps start.

I see two options for how to implement this;

*Option 1: In the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file*

I.e.

{code}
definitions:
  caches:
    node-modules: 
      directory: app/node_modules
      invalidated-by: app/package-lock.json
{code}

One drawback of this approach is that there is no obvious way to associate a file with a pre-defined cache (i.e. I want to invalidate the default node cache based on package-lock.json). Maybe could get round this issue with this (no directory is specified);

{code}
definitions:
  caches:
    node: 
      invalidated-by: package-lock.json
{code}

*Option 2: Create a new configuration page in the web interface*

!1026256818-Untitled.png|thumbnail!\\
The contents of the page would be a form-based version of the settings proposed in Option 1 above. This option would perhaps make it easier to manage the contrasts between pre-defined caches and custom caches.

I think I’d prefer option 1 but without knowing more about the underlying architecture of Pipelines I can't know if either option is significant harder to implement.

Cheers.
fields.summary: Implement automated dependency cache invalidation

fields.description:
When reviewing pull request, it would be nice to be able to *downvote*.

Sometimes, specially with a larger number of reviewers, someone might overlook an issue and *approve* (or _upvote_) the PR. As someone else have no ability to flag it as problematic, the issue might be overlooked, as it would depend on carefully reading all comments to find it out.

By allowing a downvote, a reviewer can flag it as problematic and avoid a reckless merge.
fields.summary: Downvote pull request

fields.description:
As [mentioned on Community|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/Is-there-any-Bitbucket-Pipeline-API-available/qaq-p/538056%3Futm_source%3Datlcomm%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dimmediate_general_reply%26utm_content%3Dtopic].\\
The docs for the following endpoints are currently empty/broken:

* [[https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/pipelines]](https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines?_ga=2.90345562.1319698699.1561437165-825437565.1515570924)
* [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines_config|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/pipelines_config]

This appears to be due to the endpoints being moved under the workspaces path instead of repository.
fields.summary: /pipelines and /pipelines_config REST API documentation is empty

fields.description: I cannot access to my repositories. It doesn’t show anything in the web view.
fields.summary: Cannot access to some repositories

fields.description: Any commit message that starts with {{#}} is displayed as bold in the commit message under {{Commits}} tab.  The expected behavior is that there should be no formatting in the commit message and formatting should be only applied in the wiki page and issue page.
fields.summary: Bitbucket is formatting commit message that starts with `#` in the commit tab

fields.description:
It would be great if as part of the deployment pipelines you could run deployments again, so instead of running the whole pipeline again just running the deployment steps ( Redeploy again to Test, Redeploy again to Staging etc.) I understand there is already a feature for rerunning failed pipeline steps.

One use case would be if the whole environment is being rebuild and you need to redeploy the applications
fields.summary: Rerun deployment step

The links from pipeline to settings are all functional and the size of the repository is under the 2gig max (1.1gigs)

fields.description:
It's very easy to loose track of comments still in "Preview", especially for reviews with large number of files. You basically have to scroll through all the files to find them.\\
I often keep multiple comments in preview state until I learn more about the details of the review. But it's hard to tell if all such comments were posted/discarded at the end.
fields.summary: UI to view all your the comments in "preview" state

fields.description:
This was raised previously in [Issue BCLOUD-14275 |BCLOUD-14275]but I’d like to suggest it again.

Pipelines runs unnecessarily and wastes build minutes if there are multiple commits on the same branch in a short timeframe.

It would be great to be able to configure a quiet period to wait to ensure there are no more commits before kicking off a build.
fields.summary: Implement quiet period for Pipelines to prevent unnecessary builds

fields.description: Establish a policy/guidelines for reporting security vulnerabilities with open source projects / instances (e.g. [https://help.github.com/en/articles/adding-a-security-policy-to-your-repository|https://help.github.com/en/articles/adding-a-security-policy-to-your-repository]) in light of [https://spectrum.ieee.org/tech-talk/computing/software/github-releases-new-tools-to-report-vulnerabilities|https://spectrum.ieee.org/tech-talk/computing/software/github-releases-new-tools-to-report-vulnerabilities].
fields.summary: Security reporting policy for open source projects

fields.description:
Hi,

Our builds are currently failing with:

{code}
+ npm ci
npm WARN prepare removing existing node_modules/ before installation
> node-expat@2.3.17 install /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/node_modules/node-expat
> node-gyp rebuild
gyp info it worked if it ends with ok
gyp info using node-gyp@3.8.0

gyp http GET https://nodejs.org/download/release/v10.16.0/node-v10.16.0-headers.tar.gz
gyp WARN install got an error, rolling back install
gyp ERR! configure error 
gyp ERR! stack Error: connect ETIMEDOUT 104.20.22.46:443
gyp ERR! stack     at TCPConnectWrap.afterConnect [as oncomplete] (net.js:1106:14)
gyp ERR! System Linux 4.19.43-coreos
gyp ERR! command "/usr/local/bin/node" "/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js" "rebuild"

This has been happening since around 10:30am Pacific time, still going on.
fields.summary: Users not showing up when trying to add users to user groups

fields.description:
Hello! I was recently discussing with my coworkers how it would be awesome if we could hover over a line number and have the option to simply add an emoji as a form of showing “kudos” to each other. Specifically emojis such as thumbs up, clapping, ok hand, etc. Since these are more of an encouragement function and not an “issue” with the PR, we don’t like doing this as full on comments. We reserve comments for critiquing, but a simple emoji on a line would be a way to say “good job” to our coworkers.

Just a thought!

Thank you!
fields.summary: Ability to add "kudos" emojis to line numbers

fields.description:
There might be situations where the admins/owner of an account needs to get an important message to all users who are accessing the repositories in the account. (Eg. Repository migration, admin changes or request for users to provide email addresses to the admin/owner for audit purposes)

In Bitbucket Server, this is achievable to an extent by using the 3rd party plugin, Announcer for Bitbucket Server: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211437/announcer-for-bitbucket-server?hosting=server&tab=overview&_ga=2.23396530.94010305.1560756388-715518633.1526926214|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211437/announcer-for-bitbucket-server%3Fhosting%3Dserver%26tab%3Doverview%26_ga%3D2.23396530.94010305.1560756388-715518633.1526926214]

For users who do not access the account/repositories via the UI, it would be great to be able to set an announcement in the terminal instead.
fields.summary: Allow admins/owner to display announcements to all users of the account.

fields.description:
Could we get some more PR filters? Right now we can filter by status, author, branch and inclusion in the reviewer list.

My main issue is that because we can only have one list of default reviewers, we get added to all the PRs and can’t easily tell when we are needed to answer a question/offer our opinion. We’ve been using the @ tag to accomplish this, but the inability to search by that tag and the large amount of emails that come from Bitbucket make it hard to find the items that need our action.

‌

Another way to solve this problem might be to opt in/out of certain email types (e.g. I want to see comments and approvals but not new commits or merges)
fields.summary: New Pull Request Filters

{{a14436ad053842a7b4c1605ab45e6eda}}

Our [status page|https://status.bitbucket.org] may also provide additional details.

fields.description: Previously, if I was on the “commits” page, and clicked the “commits” menu item, the page would refresh with any new commits that had been pushed. It seems that a recent (within the last month or so) change now disables this functionality, requiring I either hard refresh the page via the browser’s refresh, or navigate to a different page, and then back. I’m marking this as a bug on the commit view, since that’s the one that I’m most impacted by, but it is probably a menu change that broke it.
fields.summary: Clicking the menu for the current page does not refresh contents

fields.description:
I am trying to use ansible to download binaries so that I can install them.  I have them in the Bitbucket downloads location.

‌

I use the following to attempt to download the file

{code}
- name: temporary download folder
  tempfile:
    state: directory
    suffix: mybinaryfile
  register: mybinaryfile_download_directory

- name: download mybinaryfile binary
  get_url:
    url: https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/myteam/myproject/downloads/mybinaryfile-stable-linux-1.0.0-amd64.deb
    dest: '{{mybinaryfile_download_directory.path}}/mybinaryfile.deb'
    checksum: sha256:myfileschecksumdeadbeef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef012345678
    force_basic_auth: yes
    username: '{{bitbucket_email}}'
    password: '{{bitbucket_app_key}}'

- name: install mybinaryfile deb
  apt:
    deb: '{{mybinaryfile_download_directory.path}}/mybinaryfile.deb'

- name: remove temporary files for mybinaryfile
  file:
    path: '{{mybinaryfile_download_directory.path}}'
    state: absent
{code}

‌

When ansible sends this request, Bitbucket sends a 400 bad request in response.

I can test ansible against w3 testing server jigsaw:

{code}
- name: temporary download folder
  tempfile:
    state: directory
    suffix: jigsaw
  register: jigsaw_download_directory

- name: download jigsaw binary
  get_url:
    url: 'https://jigsaw.w3.org/HTTP/Basic/'
    dest: '{{jigsaw_download_directory.path}}/jigsaw.deb'
	checksum: sha256:myjigsawchecksumdeadbeef0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef012345678
    force_basic_auth: yes
    username: 'guest'
    password: 'guest'
{code}

Which works fine

‌

This is detailed failed response I am seeing:

{code}
fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {
    "changed": false, 
    "dest": "/tmp/ansible.Of7Vpi*********/******.deb", 
    "elapsed": 1, 
    "invocation": {
        "module_args": {
            "attributes": null, 
            "backup": null, 
            "checksum": "sha256:*********", 
            "client_cert": null, 
            "client_key": null, 
            "content": null, 
            "delimiter": null, 
            "dest": "/tmp/ansible.Of7Vpi******/*****.deb", 
            "directory_mode": null, 
            "follow": false, 
            "force": false, 
            "force_basic_auth": true, 
            "group": null, 
            "headers": null, 
            "http_agent": "ansible-httpget", 
            "mode": null, 
            "owner": null, 
            "password": "VALUE_SPECIFIED_IN_NO_LOG_PARAMETER", 
            "regexp": null, 
            "remote_src": null, 
            "selevel": null, 
            "serole": null, 
            "setype": null, 
            "seuser": null, 
            "sha256sum": "", 
            "src": null, 
            "timeout": 10, 
            "tmp_dest": null, 
            "unsafe_writes": null, 
            "url": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/*****/****/downloads/******.deb", 
            "url_password": "VALUE_SPECIFIED_IN_NO_LOG_PARAMETER", 
            "url_username": "********", 
            "use_proxy": true, 
            "username": "********", 
            "validate_certs": true
        }
    }, 
    "msg": "Request failed", 
    "response": "HTTP Error 400: Bad Request", 
    "status_code": 400, 
    "url": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/*******/*******/downloads/*******.deb"
}
{code}
fields.summary: bitbucket not compatible with ansible

fields.description:
Currently, in Pipelines, we can declare a step as performing a “deployment” to a specific environment.

In some cases, we have a temporary deployment that we then bring down (ie undeploy) on a subsequent manual pipeline step. However, there is no way to indicate to Bitbucket that this deployment is no longer deployed.

Our use case if for testing the set up of a kubernetes cluster. We have everything fully defined in a repo, we test it and then we want to undeploy the cluster once we are done testing it, since there is a cost to continue running it.

There are a number of ways to support that.  Once might be to use a minus at the end of the deployment name like:

{{deployment: test-}}

Or perhaps support something more obvious.  Lots of ways to do it in the yaml.
fields.summary: Support Undeployment

fields.description:
Our developers generally have many commits per pull request. For us, pull requests serve as the technical documentation for a given change whereas the business case is in JIRA linked to the pull request by the feature branch and in the pull request description per our own internal standards.

That said, sometimes we see a change in a file and wonder why it was made, or we track down a bug to a section of code and want to know why that code was written that way. Getting the pull requests associated with this part of the file would be ideal, but an easier solution would be to simply be able to see all the pull requests associated with the file (including pull request created date, title, and associated feature branch name). This way we can skim over the pull request titles looking for the one most likely associated with the change and go straight there to read up on the context for the change.
fields.summary: Allow easy way to view all pull requests associated with a given source file

fields.description: API request to Groups endpoint (API v1)- [https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/groups/|https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/groups/is_corp]{username} times out intermittently for large groups. Reason being, we do not paginate the endpoint results and with a huge response the request times out.
fields.summary: Request to groups v1 API endpoint - intermittently times out for large groups

fields.description: I have a Django application in which by using decoupling I am loading my config file outside of the project enviroment but at the time of using bitucket pipelines I dont know how to load such files externally.
fields.summary: Adding Config Files from outside of the project for bitbucket pipelines
